definition: to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
Vladivostok/Ming and Qing name for Vladivostok 符拉迪沃斯托克 and the province around it
bend (in a river, road etc) (used in place names)

sentences.english: Stella fell off the bike and sprained her ankle.
sentences.chinese: Stella从自行车上摔下来崴了脚。

sentences.english: Wangjiawaizi gold deposit occurs in Lower Proterozoic opimetamorphic rock series.
sentences.chinese: 王家崴子金矿床赋存于辽南古元古代浅变质岩系中。

sentences.english: I saw mother tremblingly take the porcelain basin into the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我看着母亲拿着洋瓷盆颤崴崴走到厨房去了。

sentences.english: I saw mother tremblingly take the porcelain basin into the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我看着母亲拿着洋瓷盆颤崴崴走到厨房去了。

sentences.english: Wangjiawaizi gold deposit occurrs in Lower Proterozoic opimetamorphic rock series.
sentences.chinese: 王家崴子金矿床赋存于辽南古元古代浅变质岩系中。

sentences.english: After class, I went down to the foot to sprain.
sentences.chinese: 下课了，我一下楼的把脚给崴了。

sentences.english: Waitutu Forest to meet local people and be aware of the clear-felling.
sentences.chinese: 在崴图图森林里会见当地土著和了解清除采伐的意义。

definition: to fall and break/to break (bones) by falling
to injure oneself in a fall
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
